dmv.spring.demo.util

Class MessageComposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dmv.spring.demo.util.MessageComposer

  • public class MessageComposer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an ability to lazily compose messages from the base message with replacement markers {index} and corresonding arguments 
            Example:
        base messgage - "Base message where {0} markers {1} with given {2}"
        args - [several, replaced, arguments]
        Result:
        "Base message where several markers replaced with given arguments"
    Author:
    dmv

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MessageComposer()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String compose(java.lang.String baseMsg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Simple message composer, supports up to 10 arguments (0 through 9).

    • Constructor Detail

        public MessageComposer()

    • Method Detail

      • compose

        public static java.lang.String compose(java.lang.String baseMsg,
                                       java.lang.Object... args)
        Simple message composer, supports up to 10 arguments (0 through 9).

        Currently there are no support for escape character '\', so just don't use curly braces elsewhere except for markers.

        Parameters:
        baseMsg - the base message with {index} markers
        args - Corresponding arguments. Method toString will be invoked
        Returns:
        composed message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if incorrect number of arguments or no arguments provided, or unrecognized markers used
